Achondroplasia

16 May 2014

Review of Slide Presentation

-Short limbs relative to truck, extra skin folds -Radiograph: caudal narrowing. -Hand findings: “trident hand” - fingers all about the same length -Cervical spine compression also common and concerning… -Genetics: changes to FGFR3, autosomal dominant inheritance but 80% de novo. Associated with advanced paternal age (> 35 years). Common mutation p.Gly380Arg. -Gel blot: G to A change is gain of Sfc1 restriction enzyme, this shows up in the blot. G to C chane is gain of Msp1 restriction enzyme.

Question and Answer

  • Q: any unsual health problems of barriers to health care
  • A: Saw specialists, several genetic counselors
